verses.verse: Remember <WH2142> also thy Creator <WH1254> in the days <WH3117> of thy youth <WH979>, before the evil <WH7451> days <WH3117> come <WH935>, and the years <WH8141> draw nigh <WH5060>, when thou shalt say <WH559>, I have no pleasure in them <WH2656>;
before the sun <WH8121>, and the light <WH216>, and the moon <WH3394>, and the stars <WH3556>, are darkened <WH2821>, and the clouds <WH5645> return <WH7725> after <WH310> the rain <WH1653>;

in the day <WH3117> when the keepers <WH8104> of the house <WH1004> shall tremble <WH2111>, and the strong <WH2428> men <WH582> shall bow <WH5791> themselves <WH2912>, and the grinders cease <WH988> because they are few <WH4591>, and those that look out <WH7200> of the windows <WH699> shall be darkened <WH2821>,

and the doors <WH1817> shall be shut <WH5462> in the street <WH7784>; when the sound <WH6963> of the grinding <WH2913> is low <WH8217>, and one shall rise up <WH6965> at the voice <WH6963> of a bird <WH6833>, and all the daughters <WH1323> of music <WH7892> shall be brought low <WH7817>;

yea <WH3372>, they shall be afraid of that which is high <WH1364>, and terrors <WH2849> shall be in the way <WH1870>; and the almond-tree <WH8247> shall blossom <WH5006>, and the grasshopper <WH2284> shall be a burden <WH5445>, and desire <WH35> shall fail <WH6565>; because man <WH120> goeth <WH1980> to his everlasting <WH5769> home <WH1004>, and the mourners <WH5594> go about <WH5437> the streets <WH7784>:

before <WH3808> the silver <WH3701> cord <WH2256> is loosed <WH7576>, or the golden <WH2091> bowl <WH1543> is broken <WH7533>, or the pitcher <WH3537> is broken <WH7533> at the fountain <WH4002>, or the wheel <WH1534> broken <WH7665> at the cistern <WH953>,
and the dust <WH6083> returneth <WH7725> to the earth <WH776> as it was <WH7307>, and the spirit returneth <WH7725> unto God <WH430> who gave it <WH5414>.
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities <WH1892>, saith <WH559> the Preacher <WH6953>; all is vanity <WH1892>.

And further <WH3148>, because the Preacher <WH6953> was wise <WH2450>, he still taught <WH3925> the people <WH5971> knowledge <WH1847>; yea <WH239>, he pondered, and sought out <WH2713>, and set in order <WH8626> many <WH7235> proverbs <WH4912>.
The Preacher <WH6953> sought <WH1245> to find out <WH4672> acceptable <WH2656> words <WH1697>, and that which was written <WH3789> uprightly <WH3476>, even words <WH1697> of truth <WH571>.

The words <WH1697> of the wise <WH2450> are as goads <WH1861>; and as nails <WH4930> well fastened <WH5193> are the words of the masters <WH1167> of assemblies <WH627>, which are given <WH5414> from one <WH259> shepherd <WH7462>.

And furthermore <WH3148>, my son <WH1121>, be admonished <WH2094>: of <WH1992> making <WH6213> many <WH7235> books <WH5612> there is no end <WH7093>; and much <WH7235> study <WH3854> is a weariness <WH3024> of the flesh <WH1320>.
This is the end <WH5490> of the matter <WH1697>; all hath been heard <WH8085>: fear <WH3372> God <WH430>, and keep <WH8104> his commandments <WH4687>; for this is the whole duty of man <WH120>.
For God <WH430> will bring <WH935> every work <WH4639> into judgment <WH4941>, with every hidden thing <WH5956>, whether it be good <WH2896>, or whether it be evil <WH7451>.
